title: Stolen car collides with vehicle killing two at Bald Hills causing delays on Gympie Arterial Road
text:
A head-on collision between a stolen car fleeing police and another vehicle has left two people dead and another two fighting for their lives.

The driver of a stolen Mitsubishi four-wheel drive was alleged to have been speeding and driving on the wrong side of the Gympie Arterial Road in Bald Hills, Brisbane, early on Wednesday morning when it smashed into another car, instantly killing that car's driver.

The passenger in the stolen car was also killed on impact and its driver seriously injured and taken to Princess Alexandra Hospital, the ABC reported.

Two people have been killed and another two left in a critical condition following a head-on collision with a stolen car (pictured, the crash site following the collision between the two vehicles)

Rescue crews had to also remove a passenger in the backseat of the mangled wreckage before she was rushed to Royal Brisbane Hospital in a critical condition.

Police inspector Adam Muir said the stolen vehicle had earlier been spotted at Lutwyche, about 13kms south of the crash site.

Officers had attempted to stop the vehicle though the driver got away.

'As a result that vehicle has collided with another vehicle that was heading south on that side of the road, so it's been a tragic set of circumstances where unfortunately a number of people have now lost their lives,' inspector Muir said.

Police closed down the southbound lanes of the crash site to investigate the scene until 7.40am.

While the lanes have since been reopened Queensland Traffic Metro warned drivers of extensive delays.

'Extensive delays remain back to Northlake. Please drive with caution whilst these delays remain,' it tweeted.
description: The driver of the runaway Mitsubishi four-wheel drive is alleged to have been speeding along Gympie Arterial Road in Bald Hills, Brisbane, early Tuesday morning.
authors: Aidan Wondracz For Daily Mail Australia
